answers.text:
Hi Barbara,
In Raleigh, we have one Parks superintendent and two Recreation superintendents who separately report to the director.  So, we don't have a deputy director.  We've found that works well, particularly because we're a large city with a new and developing greenway that occupies much of the parks' employees time.  We're also in an area with year-round schools, so the athletics and recreation programs tend to be popular year-round, not just during the summer.

text: What is the best way to structure a Parks & Rec department?  Would there be a Parks superintendant and a Rec superintendant separately reporting to a director... or a deputy director who oversees day to day issues/operations for both Parks & Rec who reports to a director?
